Posts.Content: I'm on Arimidex, had a diagnosis of osteopenia before the bc came along. I'm taking the generic Fosamax, and also 1500mg of calcium with D3. I had a bone density scan before I started the Arimidex and was told that I'll have one yearly as long as I'm taking the Arim. I'll be very interested in seeing what difference, if any, that the extra load of calcium and the Arimidex are making. I'm sure stiff since starting the Arim. (hips, feet & hands mainly). -rainbow4
Posts.Title: Osteoporosis diagnosis

Posts.Content: Chen, My card was in the big stack of bills and junk mail that I picked up yesterday, after being out of town for a week - the ONLY pleasant thing in the the mail! Thanks so much. and I love the "return address" label - that's now taped to the back of the card, for an additional lovely memory. Rainbow4 (Barb)
Posts.Title: Chen~You Cheated!!

Posts.Content: Just picked up today's mail, and there was a nice package - such excitement! Thank you, thank you Marlene_K (at least I think that's who it's from; the note inside tells the sender's "real" name, and I'm guessing she is the sender). If not, please let me know and I'll do some more investigating. The ornament is a beautiful glass pink ribbon with my name added in gold sparkles. I love it and will hang it proudly on my tree for MANY years to come! -rainbow4 (Barb)
Posts.Title: Another happy ornament recipient!

Posts.Content: Thank you for all the good wishes for today and long into the future. Rainbows have always been very special to me, and I thought that having to dealing with the beast, I certainly need all the inspiring things that come along. I have no birthday cake in the house, but yes! on the ice cream! -Barb
Posts.Title: Today is Rainbow4's Birthday!

Posts.Content: ohhhhh - how lovely. Thanks for sharing. That brought a few tears to my eyes. and did you rush right out to find the pot of gold at the end? For some reason I've never found that sucker - but I'll keep hunting :-) -Barb
Posts.Title: Today is Rainbow4's Birthday!

Posts.Content: Guess I need to get my grandson over here to show me how to put on an avatar. Oh, well... My b'day is Feb. 9, and you all seem pretty young to me! -rainbow4
Posts.Title: When is Your Birthday?

Posts.Content: Guess I need to get my grandson over here to show me how to put on an avatar. Oh, well... My b'day is Feb. 9, and you all seem pretty young to me! -rainbow4
Posts.Title: When is Your Birthday?

Posts.Content: I'm not doing corned beef & cabbage this year, even though I have an easy recipe done in the crockpot. Not much energy today, but I will probably toss together some Irish soda bread later. Since this is NCAA basketball tournament time, and I'm in KU country, I'm wearing my "Rock Chalk Shamrock" shirt! -rainbow4
Posts.Title: green: Who is wearing GREEN today?

Posts.Content: What an excellent suggestion - I wish I'd remembered about CaringBridge a few months ago. The 14-year-old daughter of a good friend had bone cancer a few years ago, and that's how they kept everyone informed on what was going on. I'd have used it for myself after dx in April, when everyone was asking. Now I'm past lumpectomy & sentinal lymph node disection, 7 weeks of radiation, and began Arimidex a month ago, and everyone thinks I must be "healed". Almost no one seems to inquire anymore. Maybe this is just the Arimidex talking - sorry for the "poor me" attitude today.
Posts.Title: I feel very old today...but I'm not really old
